com.ibm.mqttsample.midpapp
Class WmqttMgr

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.mqttsample.midpapp.WmqttMgr
All Implemented Interfaces:
MqttAdvancedCallback, MqttSimpleCallback
public class WmqttMgr
extends java.lang.Object
implements MqttAdvancedCallback

This class customises the MQTT Java Client API for use by the Echo application.

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

WmqttMgr

public WmqttMgr(java.lang.String theClientId,
                java.lang.String theServer,
                int thePort)
         throws MqttException
The constructor creates the MqttClient object which contains the MQTT API. It also registers this class as the one that will handle MQTT callback events.

Parameters:
theClientId - The MQTT Client identifier to use
theServer - The TCP/IP address of the broker
thePort - The TCP/IP port of the broker
Throws:
MqttException
Method Detail

disconnectClient

public boolean disconnectClient()
Disconnect the client from the broker. If any connectionLost processing is occurring then it is also stopped.

destroyClient

public boolean destroyClient()
destroyClient terminates all threads running in the MQTT implementation. Before a new connection can be made a new instance of this class must be instantiated.

setCallback

public void setCallback(MqttAdvancedCallback theCallback)
A user of this class may also want to receive callback events from MQTT. Only one object may recieve the events.

Parameters:
theCallback - The Object that wishes to receive MQTT protocol events.

connectToBroker

public void connectToBroker()
                     throws MqttException
Connect this MQTT client to the broker

Throws:
MqttException

subscribe

public boolean subscribe()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Subscribe to the request topic. The request topic is defined in this class.
This method blocks until the subscribe is acknowledged by the broker.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

unsubscribe

public void unsubscribe()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Unsubscribe from the request topic.
This method blocks until the unsubscribe is acknowledged by the broker.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

publishResponse

public void publishResponse(byte[] responseData)
                     throws MqttNotConnectedException,
                            MqttException,
                            java.lang.Exception
Publish data to the response topic. The response topic is defined in this class.

Throws:
MqttNotConnectedException
MqttException
java.lang.Exception

connectionLost

public void connectionLost()
                    throws MqttException
Handle a broken MQTT connection.
This reconnects to the broker and resubscribes to the request topic in the event of the MQTT connection unexpectedly breaking.

Specified by:
connectionLost in interface MqttSimpleCallback
Throws:
MqttException
See Also:
MqttSimpleCallback.connectionLost()
